intro: Heuffelia convoluta var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy heuffelia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its varietal name "hirsuta."
